question: Gentlemen,I recently underwent nissen fundoplication surgery by laparoscopy.  The recovery period was very painful with recurrent bouts of nausea and diarrhea.  There is also a feeling of tightness in my esophagus.  The intial finding was post surgical gastroparesis.  I was also informed that my stomach has a 4cm * 3 cm pocket, or diverticulitis (is this the right word) on the posterior part of my stomach.  Could this cause gastroparesis ?  I was having trouble even before my operation, typically feeling sleepy after lunch and sometimes feeling a little bloated, but without any nausea.  The symptoms have improved somewhat recently, but I would be interested in having your point of view.Carl_______________Dear Carl,Gastroparesis is a conditin in which the stomach does not empty appropriately due to impaired function of the gastric muscle.  There is no evidence fr mechanical blockage of the outflow tract.  Many cases of gastroparesis do not have a clear-cut etiology.  For those patients with an evident cause, the conditions include:damage to the vagus nervehypothyroidismdiabetes mellitus (sugar diabetes)medicationsinfectionmineral abnormalities )potassium, calcium)certain neurologic disorderssome collagen vascular diseasesA diverticulum would not be conidered a cause for gastroparesis.This nformationis presented for educational purpoes.  Ask specific questions to your personal physician.HFHSM.D.-rf*keywords: gastroparesis0.2
title: Gastroparesis
